message.content:
I'll solve this problem step by step, examining all the transactions to create a complete income statement.

## Step 1: Categorize the transactions and calculate revenue

First, I need to identify all sales transactions to calculate the Main Business Revenue:
- All transactions with type "Sale" represent revenue
- These revenues come from consulting and solutions services

Looking at all sales transactions from January 2, 2024 to February 5, 2024:

Total Sales Amount: 
187276.53 + 38382.28 + 49544.93 + 42123.04 + 10930.08 + 13508.51 + 13808.73 + 54853.57 + 12664.83 + 199566.18 + 11979.62 + 40755.74 + 46958.27 + 256579.57 + 12805.9 + 39275.99 + 13993.88 + 209370.21 + 2751.44 + 9553.3 + 294208.59 + 2447.22 + 10343.58 + 250134.77 + 2896.29 + 230916.68 + 13668.24 + 2365.03 + 37305.85 + 58258.83 + 2786.73 + 9561.59 + 2601.16 + 47845.24 + 41223.6 + 14606.32 + 37337.81 + 2564.48 + 9456.44 + 46394.84 + 52715.73 + 2295.46 + 2189.34 + 11773.03 + 2881.68 + 59090.75 + 12661.47 + 2641.22 + 52763.36 + 246615.65 + 9931.23 + 183770.14 + 2502.87 = 2,754,416.28

## Step 2: Calculate Cost of Goods Sold

The cost of goods sold can be calculated from the "cost_amount" values in the sales transactions.
For each sale, there's a corresponding "cost_amount" that represents the cost of delivering the service:

Total COGS:
100000 + 20000 + 20000 + 20000 + 5000 + 5000 + 5000 + 20000 + 5000 + 100000 + 5000 + 20000 + 20000 + 100000 + 5000 + 20000 + 5000 + 100000 + 1000 + 5000 + 100000 + 1000 + 5000 + 100000 + 1000 + 100000 + 5000 + 1000 + 20000 + 20000 + 1000 + 5000 + 1000 + 20000 + 20000 + 5000 + 20000 + 1000 + 5000 + 20000 + 20000 + 1000 + 1000 + 5000 + 1000 + 20000 + 5000 + 1000 + 20000 + 100000 + 5000 + 100000 + 1000 = 1,296,000.00

## Step 3: Calculate Gross Profit

Gross Profit = Revenue - COGS = 2,754,416.28 - 1,296,000.00 = 1,458,416.28

## Step 4: Identify and sum all expenses by category

### Administrative Expenses
From transactions labeled "Administrative Expenses":
11406.69 + 2296.4 + 4123.93 + 14216.99 + 2948.88 + 3735.72 + 16585.16 + 7152.4 + 3054.48 + 5765.02 + 6657.84 + 9089.07 + 9692.9 + 14693.47 = 111,418.95

### Selling Expenses
From transactions labeled "Sales Expenses": 
15779.23 + 4102.96 + 3093.29 + 6637.42 + 8026.41 + 12770.5 + 11640.26 + 2017.12 + 11778.13 + 4325.6 + 10465.92 + 18057.23 + 13673.38 + 16231.75 + 17491.65 + 15573.97 + 16409.05 + 13588.7 + 2942.5 + 3346.81 + 7433.08 + 12754.4 + 10587.54 + 5517.94 + 2221.08 + 6492.38 + 13115.04 + 14803.98 + 5320.13 + 10187.11 + 15401.55 + 3776.42 + 12933.89 + 16815.32 = 344,905.74

### Depreciation
From transactions labeled "Depreciation":
45752.22 + 45750.84 = 91,503.06

### Financial Expenses
From transactions labeled "Financial Expenses":
17950.19 + 5903.14 + 17508.75 + 8804.91 = 50,166.99

## Step 5: Calculate Interest Income

From transactions labeled "Interest Receivables":
430.76 + 430.76 + 429.42 + 420.52 + 420.52 + 420.52 + 416.52 + 416.52 + 416.52 + 412.07 + 412.07 + 412.07 + 412.07 + 411.80 + 411.80 + 411.80 + 411.80 + 411.80 + 411.80 + 411.54 + 411.54 + 411.54 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.98 + 407.71 + 407.71 + 407.71 + 407.53 = 14,367.06

## Step 6: Calculate Total Expenses

Total Expenses = Administrative Expenses + Selling Expenses + Depreciation + Financial Expenses
Total Expenses = 111,418.95 + 344,905.74 + 91,503.06 + 50,166.99 = 597,994.74

## Step 7: Calculate Profit Before Tax

Profit Before Tax = Gross Profit + Interest Income - Total Expenses
Profit Before Tax = 1,458,416.28 + 14,367.06 - 597,994.74 = 874,788.60

## Step 8: Calculate Tax Expense

Looking at the sales transactions, I can sum up all the tax amounts:
9363.83 + 1919.11 + 2477.25 + 2106.15 + 546.5 + 675.43 + 690.44 + 2742.68 + 633.24 + 9978.31 + 598.98 + 2037.79 + 2347.91 + 12828.98 + 640.3 + 1963.8 + 699.69 + 10468.51 + 137.57 + 477.66 + 14710.43 + 122.36 + 517.18 + 12506.74 + 144.81 + 11545.83 + 683.41 + 118.25 + 1865.29 + 2912.94 + 139.34 + 478.08 + 130.06 + 2392.26 + 2061.18 + 730.32 + 1866.89 + 128.22 + 472.82 + 2319.74 + 2635.79 + 114.77 + 109.47 + 588.65 + 144.08 + 2954.54 + 633.07 + 132.06 + 2638.17 + 12330.78 + 496.56 + 9188.51 + 125.14 = 147,723.63

## Step 9: Calculate Net Profit

Net Profit = Profit Before Tax - Tax Expense
Net Profit = 874,788.60 - 147,723.63 = 727,064.97

## Step 10: Prepare the income statement

Now I'll format the results according to the requested format:

```json
{"solution": {
    "Main Business Revenue": "2754416.28",
    "Total Revenue": "2754416.28",
    "Cost of Goods Sold": "1296000.00",
    "Total Cost": "1296000.00",
    "Gross Profit": "1458416.28",
    "Administrative Expenses": "111418.95",
    "Selling Expenses": "344905.74",
    "Depreciation": "91503.06",
    "Financial Expenses": "50166.99",
    "Total Expenses": "597994.74",
    "Interest Income": "14367.06",
    "Profit Before Tax": "874788.60",
    "Tax Expense": "147723.63",
    "Net Profit": "727064.97"
}}
```
